triplets: Fitness equipment designed for strength training, consisting of a long bar with adjustable or fixed weights at each end
Weightlifting exercises including squats, deadlifts, bench press, and Olympic lifting for strength and muscle development
Steel or iron for the bar and weight plates; rubber or urethane coating may be used on plates to protect floors and reduce noise
Bar, the long central rod that holds the weight plates and is gripped by the user
Weight plates that are loaded onto the bar to adjust resistance
Collars or clamps to secure weight plates on the bar
Varies depending on materials and manufacturer; bars are usually metallic gray or black, plates may be black, colored, or coated
Gym equipment, home fitness setups, strength training programs, and competitive weightlifting
Various fitness equipment manufacturers producing standard, Olympic, and specialty barbells
Varies depending on bar and plates; standard bars range from 5–20 kg, Olympic bars 20–25 kg, with plates adding 1–50 kg or more each
Approximately 1.2–2.2 meters in length depending on type (standard or Olympic)
Typically 10–20 years or more with proper maintenance, depending on material quality, usage frequency, and storage conditions
